constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: KEYACH Name: Tolworth Key Area of Change
AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT
SWFD Pipe Reference: GSPurpose: SURFACE

description: Details required for Conditions 4 (Window Reveals, Door Reveals, Overhangs, Rainwater Goods), 5 (Construction Management Plan), 7 (Cycle Parking), 8 (Fence Specification), 9,10 (Sustainability and Energy Conservation), 11 (Landscaping), 12 (Refuse) and 13 (Sustainable Drainage Strategy) of planning permission 20/00634/FUL (Sub-dividing site and erection of 2 x bedrooms 2 storey dwelling)
decision_conditions: The applicant has not adequately demonstrated that condition 5 (Construction Management Plan), of planning permission 20/00634/FUL can be discharged. The Schedule of Conditions table, which includes details for Condition 5, does not constitute an acceptable Construction Management Plan, containing very limited detail, with no illustration and limited justification of what is stated, to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and to safeguard highway safety and the free flow of traffic in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The applicant has not adequately demonstrated that condition 7 (Cycle Parking), of planning permission 20/00634/FUL can be discharged, by stating cycle parking will be contained within a shed in the back garden, without any illustration of the interior, type of stands, accessibility, to ensure the provision of satisfactory cycle storage facilities and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with Policy DM8 (Sustainable Transport for New Developments) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The applicant has not adequately demonstrated that condition 10 (Sustainability), of planning permission 20/00634/FUL can be discharged, as the applicant has stated the water efficiency standard is more than 110 litres per person per day maximum water, in the interests of Sustainability and Energy Conservation in accordance with Policy SI 5 (Water infrastructure) of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM1 (Sustainable Design and Construction Standards) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The applicant has not adequately demonstrated that condition 11 (Landscaping), of planning permission 20/00634/FUL can be discharged, as the applicant does not state the size of the proposed trees at the time of planting and the new house built on the land to the side of the existing includes no details of landscaping, in the interests of visual amenity and also that the Local Planning Authority shall be satisfied as to the details of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
